data.title: Abigail Spencer Movies and Tv shows: A Look at Abigail Spencer Memorable Roles
data.meta_description: Abigail Spencer is a skilled American actress who is well recognized for her role in Oz the Great and Powerful, Suits, Rectify, The Haunting in Connecticut 2: Ghosts of Georgia, and Hawthorne.
data.text:
American actress Abigail Leigh Spencer came into this world on August 4, 1981. Before starring in Angela’s Eyes (2006), a criminal thriller series on Lifetime, she started her career portraying Rebecca Tyree on the ABC daytime serial opera All My Children (1999–2001). Additional recurring parts include those on Mad Men (2009), Hawthorne (2009–2011), Suits (2011–2019), and Grey’s Anatomy (2017–2022). She was nominated for a Critics’ Choice Television Award for her role as Amantha Holden in the Sundance TV drama series Rectify, which ran from 2013 to 2016. Abigail Spencer played the role of Lucy Preston, a history professor, in the NBC science fiction series Timeless from 2016 to 2018. She made a couple of appearances in the tv series, In My Sleep (2010), Cowboys & Aliens (2011), This Means War (2012), Oz the Great and Powerful (2013).

Abigail Spencer Young

Abigail is the daughter of a surfer, Yancy Spencer III (1950–2011) and Lydia Ann Brown; the family lived in Gulf Breeze, Santa Rosa County, Florida. She has two brothers Sterling Spencer (born in )1986 and Yancy Spencer IV (born in 1973).

Professional Life

From June 3, 1999, until April 10, 2001, Abigail Spencer took on her first significant role as Rebecca Tyree on the ABC daytime drama All My Children. Following that, in December 2006, she appeared in the Lifetime original series Angela’s Eyes until it was canceled. Her guest appearances on tv series like Castle, How I Met Your Mother, Private Practice, and CSI: Crime Scene Investigation started in the years that followed.

In 2009, Spencer portrayed Miss Farrell, Don Draper’s love interest on AMC’s Mad Men, and she has also appeared in Twix commercials as a blogging fan. Three years later, she landed a lead role in the ABC drama pilot Grace. Before then, she made an appearance as a lead character in the 2005 Krista Vernoff drama pilot, Introducing Lennie Rose.

Abigail Spencer played a recurring role as Dr. Erin Jameson in 2010 in the TNT series Hawthorne. She played Gabriel Macht’s former adversary, Dana “Scottie,” in the 2011–2019 USA Network legal drama Suits. She later landed the role of a main actress in The Haunting in Connecticut 2: Ghosts of Georgia (2013) and has been in other films, such as In My Sleep (2010), Cowboys & Aliens (2011), This Means War (2012), and Chasing Mavericks (2012).

For her role as Amantha Holden in the 2013–2017 Sundance Channel drama series Rectify, Abigail Spencer garnered praises from critics. In recognition of her work in the series, she was nominated for two awards: one for Best Supporting Actress in a Drama Series from Critics’ Choice Television and another for Best Actress – Television Series Drama from Satellite.

In the independent drama A Beautiful Now, starring Spencer, writer Daniela Amavia follows a passionate dancer who, at a crossroads in her life, contemplates an extreme deed. There was talk of a Best Actress nomination for her at the Madrid International Film Festival. Following her 2014 appearance in Shawn Levy’s ensemble comedy This Is Where I Leave You, in which she co-starred with Jason Bateman, Spencer went on to act in the criminal thriller The Forger with John Travolta and Christopher Plummer.

Abigail Spencer became a member of the True Detective cast in October 2014 and has been a regular cast member since. In 2016, she bagged a major role as she was featured in the NBC series, Timeless as Lucy Preston, a history professor. The time-travel film follows a history professor sent on missions to various periods to stop others from interfering with the U.S.-related timestream. Her performance in this series earned her praises from influential brands like Variety, describing Lucy as a smart and plucky character and also added that she is a prodigiously talented actress.

According to Deadline Hollywood’s evaluation, Spencer’s abilities were utterly wasted on the program. New York Times didn’t hold back their compliments. The NYT reviewer described her as the show’s principal heroine and sassy historian. The NBC show was cancelled but later renewed for two seasons.

Abigail Spencer launched her film production company, Innerlight Films with Duke Johnson. They have released award-winning films like Here and Now, and Winter Light (2015). Currently, they are working on a film, The Actor, starring André Holland and Gemma Chan. It is reported that filming has been completed for this project. However, the production company is yet to set a release date.

Meanwhile, Spencer has been entertaining her fans and viewers with her performance in the NBC sitcom, The Extended Family.

Abigail Spencer Measurements

Abigail Spencer height stands at 165 centimeters (1.65 meters) tall. Her chest, waist, and hip measurements are 34-24-35 inches respectively. She also has dark brown hair and brown eyes. She wears a size 7.5 US shoes and a size 32B bra.

How old is Abigail Spencer?

Born on the 4th of August 1981, Abigail Spencer is currently 42 years old.

Where does Abigail Spencer live?

In 2019, it was reported that she was living in North California filming Reprisal.

How much is Abigail Spencer net worth?

Abigail Spencer is enjoying a net worth estimated to be about 3 million dollars.

Who is Abigail Spencer boyfriend?

Abigail Spencer was initially married to Andrew Pruett with whom she shares a son, Roman. Currently, she’s entangled in a love affair with a Spanish guy who is assumed by People as Oscar Valls.

Abigail Spencer Awards

AbigailSpencer acting career has secured her two awards and three nominations so far. Her wins include:

In 2000, she won the Outstanding Female Newcomer Award from Soap Opera Digest for her role is All My Children.

In 2015, she won the Best Independent Short Film award along with other members of the cast for their excellent job in Winter Lights.

Quick Facts

Abigail Spencer father was Pensacola surfing legend Yancy Spencer.

She began competing in beauty pageants at age 4.

She appeared in the musical Annie at age 12.

She was a member of the Pensacola Children’s Chorus.

She portrayed Rebecca Tyree on All My Children from 1999 to 2001 and snagged a Soap Opera Digest Award as Outstanding Female Newcomer for her work.

She stayed with family friend Kathie Lee Gifford when she relocated to New York to film AMC.

She had a recurring role on season 3 of Mad Men as Suzanne Farrell, Sally Draper’s teacher and Don Draper’s love interest.

Summary

American actress Abigail Spencer came into this world in Gulf Breeze, Florida on August 4, 1981. She first came to prominence in the late 1990s, when she started appearing in a number of films and television series. “Rectify,” “Timeless,” and cameos in “Oz the Great and Powerful” and “The Forger” are among notable works. A multi-genre performer, Spencer has garnered praise for her work. As an actress who prefers to maintain a low profile outside of work, you may not hear much about her private life.
